comment: This is a page from an ancient Chinese dictionary or lexicographical text, likely a version of the *Shuowen Jiezi* (说文解字), which explains the origins and meanings of Chinese characters. The layout includes small seal script (小篆) characters on the left, followed by their definitions, phonetic readings (in *fanqie* notation), and etymological explanations. The right margin contains page numbers and section identifiers (e.g., '十三', '陆安'). The black border frames the main content block.
